metadata.name: Azure Active Directory Hybrid Health AD FS New Server
metadata.comment: This detection uses azureactivity logs (Administrative category) to identify the creation or update of a server instance in an Azure AD Hybrid health AD FS service. A threat actor can create a new AD Health ADFS service and create a fake server instance to spoof AD FS signing logs. There is no need to compromise an on-prem AD FS server. This can be done programmatically via HTTP requests to Azure.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM entity_management WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND lower(entity.type) = lower('administrative') AND lower(cloud.provider) = lower('microsoft.adhybridhealthservice') AND contains(lower(entity.uid), lower('adfederationservice')) AND lower(api.operation) = lower('microsoft.adhybridhealthservice/services/servicemembers/action'))
